info.description: CRM Relation API for customer, project, and sales pipeline management
info.title: Straye Relation API

get.description: Get paginated list of activities with optional filters

parameters.description: Filter by activity type (meeting, task, call, email, note)
parameters.name: type

parameters.description: Filter by status (planned, in_progress, completed, cancelled)
parameters.name: status

parameters.description: Filter by target type (customer, project, offer, deal)
parameters.name: targetType

parameters.description: Filter activities from this date (YYYY-MM-DD), inclusive from 00:00:00
parameters.name: from

parameters.description: Filter activities to this date (YYYY-MM-DD), inclusive until 23:59:59
parameters.name: to

post.description: Create a new activity (meeting, task, call, email, or note)

get.description: Get current user's incomplete tasks (assigned tasks that are not completed or cancelled)
Get activity status counts for the current user's dashboard
Get upcoming scheduled activities for the current user within a specified number of days

parameters.description: Number of days to look ahead (1-90)
parameters.name: daysAhead

parameters.description: Maximum number of activities to return (1-100)
parameters.name: limit

get.description: Get a single activity by its ID

put.description: Update an existing activity

post.description: Add a user as an attendee to a meeting activity

delete.description: Remove a user from the attendees list of a meeting activity

post.description: Mark an activity as completed with an optional outcome
Create a follow-up task from a completed activity

get.description: Get paginated list of customers with optional filters

parameters.description: Search by name or organization number
parameters.name: search

post.description: Create a new customer

get.description: Compare customers in the ERP data warehouse with customers in our database. Returns customers that exist in ERP but not in our local database, and customers that exist locally but not in ERP. For organizations, matching is done by organization number. For private persons (no org number), matching is done by name.
get.summary: Get differences between ERP and local customers

get.description: Find the single best matching customer for a query using fuzzy matching (handles typos, abbreviations, partial matches). Use q=all to get all customers. Returns minimal customer data (id and name only). Also supports email domain matching (e.g., 'hauk@straye.no' matches 'Straye').
get.summary: Fuzzy search for best matching customer

parameters.description: Search query (e.g., 'AF', 'NTN', 'Veidikke', 'all' for all customers, or email like 'user@company.no')
parameters.name: q

get.description: Get a customer with full details including stats, contacts, active deals, and projects

put.description: Update an existing customer

delete.description: Soft delete a customer. The customer is hidden from lists but preserved for historical reference. Related projects and offers keep their customer reference.

Update only the city of a customer
Assign or unassign a customer to/from a company
Update the contact person, email, and phone of a customer

get.description:
Returns dashboard metrics with configurable time range. All metrics exclude draft and expired offers.

**IMPORTANT: Aggregation Logic (Avoids Double-Counting)**
When a project has multiple offers, only the highest value offer per phase is counted.
Orphan offers (without project) are included at full value.
Example: Project A has offers 23M and 25M in "sent" phase - totalValue shows 25M, not 48M.

**Time Range Options:**
- `rolling12months` (default): Uses a rolling 12-month window from the current date
- `allTime`: Calculates metrics without any date filter
- Custom range: Use `fromDate` and `toDate` parameters (YYYY-MM-DD format)

**Custom Date Range:**
When `fromDate` and/or `toDate` are provided, they override the `timeRange` parameter.
- `fromDate`: Start of range at 00:00:00 local time
- `toDate`: End of range at 23:59:59 local time
- Both parameters are optional; can be used together or individually

**Offer Metrics (Pipeline Phase):**
- `totalOfferCount`: Count of offers excluding drafts and expired
- `totalProjectCount`: Count of unique projects with offers (excludes orphan offers)
- `offerReserve`: Total value of active offers - best per project (avoids double-counting)
- `weightedOfferReserve`: Sum of (value * probability/100) for active offers
- `averageProbability`: Average probability of active offers

**Pipeline Data:**
- Returns phases: in_progress, sent, order, completed, lost with counts and values
- `count`: Total offer count in phase
- `projectCount`: Unique projects in phase (excludes orphan offers)
- `totalValue`: Sum of best offer value per project (avoids double-counting)
- Excludes draft and expired offers

**Win Rate Metrics:**
- `winRate`: won_count / (won_count + lost_count) - returns 0-1 scale (e.g., 0.5 = 50%)
- `economicWinRate`: won_value / (won_value + lost_value) - value-based win rate
- Also includes `wonCount`, `lostCount`, `wonValue`, `lostValue` for transparency

**Order Metrics (Execution Phase - from offers):**
- `activeOrderCount`: Count of offers in order phase (active execution)
- `completedOrderCount`: Count of offers in completed phase
- `orderValue`: Total value of offers in order phase
- `orderReserve`: Sum of (value - invoiced) for order phase offers
- `totalInvoiced`: Sum of invoiced for order phase offers
- `totalSpent`: Sum of spent for order phase offers
- `averageOrderProgress`: Average completion percentage for order phase offers
- `healthDistribution`: Count of order phase offers by health status (onTrack, atRisk, delayed, overBudget)

**Financial Summary:**
- `totalValue`: orderReserve + totalInvoiced

**Recent Lists (limit 5 each):**
- `recentOffers`: Offers in in_progress phase (Siste tilbud), sorted by update recency
- `recentOrders`: Offers in order phase (Siste ordre), sorted by update recency

**Top Customers:** Ranked by won offer count (order + completed phases) with total won value

parameters.description: Time range for metrics (ignored if fromDate/toDate provided)
parameters.name: timeRange

parameters.description: Start date for custom range (YYYY-MM-DD format, 00:00:00)
parameters.name: fromDate

parameters.description: End date for custom range (YYYY-MM-DD format, 23:59:59)
parameters.name: toDate

400.description: Invalid timeRange value or date format

post.description:
Creates a new offer. Defaults to in_progress phase (use /inquiries for draft phase).
Supports three scenarios for customer/project association:
- customerId only: Creates offer with that customer, auto-creates project
- projectId only: Inherits customer from the existing project
- Both: Uses provided customer, links to specified project

400.description: Validation error (missing customerId/projectId, project has no customer, etc.)

post.description:
Manually triggers a sync of ALL offers with external_reference from the data warehouse (regardless of phase).
Also syncs all assignments for offers in "order" phase. This is an admin-only endpoint for forcing a full sync outside of the scheduled cron job.
post.summary: Trigger bulk data warehouse sync (Admin only)

200.description: Sync results with synced/failed counts for offers and assignments

get.description: Returns a preview of what the next offer number would be for a company without consuming the sequence. Useful for UI display.

delete.description: Delete an offer by ID. Only offers in draft or in_progress phase can be deleted.

post.description: Transitions an offer from sent phase to won phase. Optionally creates a project from the offer.

400.description: Invalid offer ID, request body, or offer not in sent phase

post.description: Transitions a won offer to order phase, indicating work is beginning. This is used when a customer accepts a sent offer and work should start.

400.description: Invalid offer ID, request body, or offer not in valid phase

get.description: Returns all synced assignments (work orders) for a specific offer

Returns aggregated assignment data with comparison to the offer value.
Includes total FixedPriceAmount, count, and difference calculations.
get.summary: Get assignment summary for an offer

post.description:
Fetches assignments (work orders) from the ERP datawarehouse and syncs them to the local database.
The offer must have an external_reference that matches the project Code in the ERP system.

get.description:
Syncs financial data from the data warehouse for the given offer and persists it.
The offer must have an external_reference to be matched in the data warehouse.
This endpoint queries the DW, persists the financial data to the offer, and returns the result.
get.summary: Sync data warehouse financials for an offer

200.description: Data warehouse financials with sync status

get.description: Returns a list of active users. Super admins and gruppen users see all users. Regular users see only users from their company.

createProject.description: If true, create a project from this offer

project.description: Only present if createProject was true

notes.description: Notes is an optional note about why this order was accepted

createProject.description: If true and no ProjectID, auto-create a project when advancing from draft

includeBudget.description: Default true - clone budget items (nil treated as true)

includeFiles.description: Default false - files are not cloned by default

templateOfferId.description: Optional: copy budget dimensions from this offer

createProject.description: If true and no ProjectID, auto-create a project

customerId.description: Optional if projectId is provided (inherits from project)

expirationDate.description: Optional, defaults to 60 days after sent date

totalValueActive.description: Value of offers in in_progress or sent phases

totalValueWon.description: Value of offers in order or completed phases

missingInERP.description: Customers in local DB but not in ERP

missingInLocal.description: Customers in ERP but not in local DB

syncedAt.description: ISO 8601 - When the comparison was performed

activeOffers.description: Count of offers in order phase (active orders)

completedOffers.description: Count of offers in completed phase

fileCount.description: Count of files attached to the customer

totalValueActive.description: Value of offers in order phase (active orders)

totalValueWon.description: Value of offers in order or completed phases

workingOffers.description: Count of offers in in_progress or sent phases

totalValueActive.description: Value of offers in in_progress or sent phases

totalValueWon.description: Value of offers in order or completed phases

activeOrderCount.description:
Order Metrics (from offers in order and completed phases)
Execution tracking has moved from projects to offers

averageOrderProgress.description: Average completion_percent for order phase offers

completedOrderCount.description: Count of offers in completed phase

fromDate.description: FromDate is set when using custom date range (start of range, 00:00:00)

healthDistribution.description: Count of order phase offers by health status

offerReserve.description: Total value of active offers - best per project (avoids double-counting)

orderReserve.description: Sum of (value - invoiced) for order phase offers

orderValue.description: Total value of offers in order phase

pipeline.description:
Pipeline Data (phases: in_progress, sent, order, lost - excludes draft and expired)
Uses aggregation: for projects with multiple offers, only the highest value per phase is counted

recentOrders.description: Offers in order phase (Siste ordre), sorted by updated_at DESC

timeRange.description: TimeRange indicates the time range used for the metrics

toDate.description: ToDate is set when using custom date range (end of range, 23:59:59)

totalInvoiced.description: Sum of invoiced for order phase offers

totalProjectCount.description: Count of unique projects with offers (excludes orphan offers)

totalSpent.description: Sum of spent for order phase offers

weightedOfferReserve.description: Sum of (value * probability/100) for active offers

connected.description: Whether data warehouse connection was successful

notes.example: Lost to competitor XYZ who offered lower price

companyId.description: The company ID this number is for

nextOfferNumber.description: The next offer number that would be assigned, e.g., "TK-2025-001"

year.description: The year component of the number

customerHasWonProject.description: Whether customer has won their project

customerId.description: Optional - offer can exist without customer

dwTotalFixedPrice.description: Sum of FixedPriceAmount from synced assignments

expirationDate.description: ISO 8601 - When offer expires (default 60 days after sent)

managerId.description: Order phase execution fields (used when phase = "order" or "completed")

warnings.description:
Validation warnings - computed at DTO mapping time
Possible values: value.not.equals.dwTotalFixedPrice
